title: Looking for complementary font to Arial for WEB
content:
Hi guys,  
I'm kinda creatively stuck and can't seem to find a good solution, so I thought I might ask youm, the experts.  
I have a website that I'm putting together very minimal, the main copy is Arial and I'm looking for a nice simple preferably sans serif font for menus and headlines to go with it. the website is fashion oriented so I'm trying to find something that has personality. I was also considering Slabserif (Jubilat or Archer) but my preference is really sans.  
Do you have any thoughts or ideas as to what could work? it should also have different weights and italics as well as being CE or multilingual.

Any feedback is appreciated :)

Thank you,  
Michal
author: mimik

comments.content: _Thin_ is definitely in, in fashion. [Hairline Archer](http://web.archive.org/web/20130619220144/http:/typography.com/fonts/font_features.php?featureID=69&productLineID=100033) or [Chalet](http://web.archive.org/web/20130619220144/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=4&subpage=viewfonts) may fit the bill.

Thanks Boardman, Chalet looks nice.

Any other suggestions guys?

M.

Check out [Auto](http://web.archive.org/web/20130619220144/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php?id1=auto&id2=overview) and [Sauna](http://web.archive.org/web/20130619220144/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php?id1=sauna&id2=overview), both by Underware. Auto, in particular, has some really nice italics.
